short_description: Discover the heart of Europe, Austria, where stunning Alpine landscapes meet rich cultural heritage. Experience world-class skiing, classical music, historic cities, imperial palaces, and the famous Viennese coffee culture in this elegant Central European destination.

health.tap_water_safety: Safe to drink - Austria has excellent water quality
alcohol_info: Beer and wine can be purchased and consumed at age 16
Spirits and other alcoholic beverages require age 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, supermarkets, and shops

weather.title: Austria has a temperate continental climate with cold winters and warm summers. The Alpine regions experience more extreme weather with heavy snowfall in winter, while the eastern lowlands have milder conditions.

when_to_visit.title: Winter Ski Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Cold and snowy conditions perfect for skiing and winter sports in the Austrian Alps. World-renowned ski resorts like Innsbruck, Kitzb√ºhel, and St. Anton offer excellent slopes. Great time for winter activities and apr√®s-ski culture

when_to_visit.title: Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: Warm and pleasant temperatures ideal for hiking, outdoor activities, and exploring cities. Perfect for visiting Vienna, Salzburg, and the beautiful Alpine lakes. Great time for music festivals and cultural events

when_to_visit.title: Spring & Autumn
when_to_visit.time_period: April to May, September to October
when_to_visit.short_description: Mild temperatures with beautiful seasonal colors. Perfect for sightseeing, exploring historic cities, hiking in the mountains, and enjoying cultural attractions without the peak season crowds

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Austria depends on your interests: visit during winter (December to March) for world-class skiing in the Alps, or during summer (June to August) for hiking, city exploration, and cultural events. Spring and autumn offer mild weather and fewer crowds
